message: for me it suggests "connor"
congrats @leah
but hey, it's only been 5 minutes or so :P
@protocool thanks!
blog post with more info: http://blog.convore.com/post/3748606742/convore-iphone-app
we now have an iPhone app. Yay!
and what does it mean for the API? :-)
No iTunes, I did *not* mean "convert" damn-you!
http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/convore/id424470699?mt=8
let me know if you have any questions about what this means for the API
@protocool mostly it just means it's more stable
hrm... not in the Canadian store yet I guess
@protocool it seems to be creeping into the store slowly... like it's not in the App Store app on the phone yet either
@leah hullo from a Canadian iPhone
also - not sure who wrote the app, but if you want your avatars to continue to load while scroll-events are occurring in the tableview:

that wasn't meant to sound like "don't know who the idiot was who wrote the app" - just meant to be "I don't know who to pass that info on to". It's just a nice touch when cell images don't delay loading while your finger is down or it's scrolling...
Congrats Leah, it works all right!
@protocool FWIW it was @leah and @markpasc who wrote the app and I pitched in a liiiitle
@markpasc works for convore?
@kingcode we contracted him to help out on the app
@ericflo nice!
The iPhone app is awesome. Installed it yesterday after I read the blog post. So much more comfortable than using convore on the iPhone via web.
any plans to support push notifications?
